intro: Hieracium crepidiflorum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium crepidiflorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
